description: The data structure that describe the configuration of a NATS JetStream Consumer
title: io.nats.jetstream.api.v1.consumer_configuration

opt_start_time.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

durable_name.description: A unique name for a durable consumer
durable_name.deprecationMessage: Durable is deprecated. All consumers will have names. picked by clients.

name.description: A unique name for a consumer

description.description: A short description of the purpose of this consumer

deliver_policy.description: The point in the stream from which to receive messages

deliver_subject.description: The subject push consumers delivery messages to

deliver_group.description: The queue group name used to distribute messages among subscribers

ack_wait.description: How long (in nanoseconds) to allow messages to remain un-acknowledged before attempting redelivery
ack_wait.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

max_deliver.description: The number of times a message will be delivered to consumers if not acknowledged in time
max_deliver.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

filter_subject.description: Filter the stream by a single subjects

filter_subjects.description: Filter the stream by multiple subjects

replay_policy.description: The rate at which messages will be pushed to a client

sample_freq.description: Sets the percentage of acknowledgments that should be sampled for observability

rate_limit_bps.description: The rate at which messages will be delivered to clients, expressed in bit per second

max_ack_pending.description: The maximum number of messages without acknowledgement that can be outstanding, once this limit is reached message delivery will be suspended
max_ack_pending.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

idle_heartbeat.description: If the Consumer is idle for more than this many nano seconds a empty message with Status header 100 will be sent indicating the consumer is still alive
idle_heartbeat.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

flow_control.description: For push consumers this will regularly send an empty mess with Status header 100 and a reply subject, consumers must reply to these messages to control the rate of message delivery

max_waiting.description: The number of pulls that can be outstanding on a pull consumer, pulls received after this is reached are ignored
max_waiting.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

direct.description: Creates a special consumer that does not touch the Raft layers, not for general use by clients, internal use only

headers_only.description: Delivers only the headers of messages in the stream and not the bodies. Additionally adds Nats-Msg-Size header to indicate the size of the removed payload

max_batch.description: The largest batch property that may be specified when doing a pull on a Pull Consumer

max_expires.description: The maximum expires value that may be set when doing a pull on a Pull Consumer
max_expires.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

max_bytes.description: The maximum bytes value that maybe set when doing a pull on a Pull Consumer
max_bytes.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

inactive_threshold.description: Duration that instructs the server to cleanup ephemeral consumers that are inactive for that long
inactive_threshold.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

backoff.description: List of durations in Go format that represents a retry time scale for NaK'd messages

items.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

num_replicas.description: When set do not inherit the replica count from the stream but specifically set it to this amount
num_replicas.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

mem_storage.description: Force the consumer state to be kept in memory rather than inherit the setting from the stream

pause_until.description: When creating a consumer supplying a time in the future will act as a deadline for when the consumer will be paused till
pause_until.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

priority_groups.description: List of priority groups this consumer supports

priority_policy.description: The priority policy the consumer is set to

priority_timeout.description: For pinned_client priority policy how long before the client times out
priority_timeout.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

opt_start_seq.description: Start sequence used with the DeliverByStartSequence deliver policy.

opt_start_time.description: Start time used with the DeliverByStartSequence deliver policy
opt_start_time.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC
